review: For the price, I cannot complain at all... it works MUCH better than that piece of crap Samsung HomeSync and it's only a tenth the price! Unfortunately, it only streams from Netflix, YouTube, Hulu Plus, Google Play Movies, and Google Play Music. It won't stream existing videos on your phone or from your network, so if you're getting it for that, don't bother. I have a couple of TVs that aren't "smart" and I've watched a few Netflix and a couple of YouTube videos on my 60" plasma, it looked fine and the sound was good. Setup was too simple with absolutely no challenge, boring, but a good thing! I plugged it into the HDMI and used the USB on the TV so it doesn't have to stay on 24/7. It popped up with a URL to go to, I went, it found the ChromeCast, it set it up, I didn't even have to find my wireless password, totally lazy... you control it with your crApple (I think), Android phone/tablet/laptop, or Google Chrome browser. I just ordered another "idiot box" and will likely get another ChromeCast... in fact, I'll order it while I'm here.
author: Dave the Pear

review: Easy to setup, easy to use. I use this a lot. It has become the primary way I watch youtube and netflix, replacing my apple tv for the most part. I did have to restart the device once or twice since I have owned it to fix some glitchs. Steaming from a computer works pretty good. I just wish more apps supported it, which is happening slowly.
author: Tim

review: Had this little guy for over a month before setting it up...Last night finally took the time to set it up...Set up was super easy, as you'd expect from Google...then used it for the evening...All I can say is awesome...If you want a way to use your computer to throw content to your HDMI connected TV,then this is it. Just bring up your CHROME browser, using the Chromecast extension(which both are vey easy to set up) and choose to CAST it...there ya go. On your hdmi connected TV flowing through your local wireless network.
